website_summaries.verdict: Durable and comfortable belaying gloves that are also great for any number of tasks, such as yard word or ranch work.
pros: Real leather gloves that are built to last
Thick enough to protect your hand but still have a good feel for the rope
Many people used them for far more than climbing, including working on construction sites and as grocery stockers
cons: Run big and some owners found them unwieldy

customer_reviews.title: They are also pretty stiff. If you prefer a snugger
customer_reviews.text: I typed in WOMEN'S belay gloves, saw these ordered a medium and guess what - they are actually uni-sex. I have very small hands and these were way too big. I found the same ones at REI and even the extra small did not fit me (too big). They are also pretty stiff. If you prefer a snugger, more pliable belay gloves, this is not for you. They did seem well made and sturdy. But women's hands and men's hands - huge difference. I sadly had to return them and the hunt continues.
customer_reviews.author: Cyndie Barone

customer_reviews.title: Repelling is what they are supposedly good for
customer_reviews.text: Too slippery for rope climbs. Cost a lot of money and they have no grip . They are made of durable leather . I used them for rope cleans mobs which they are not made for I guess. Repelling is what they are supposedly good for
customer_reviews.author: Talal El Oukaili

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: The double layered leather palms are good protection from rope burn. The gloves are however slippery making it hard to hold onto a rope.
customer_reviews.author: Mike McMillian

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy the black gloves!!!
customer_reviews.text: The gloves in design are great. Good dexterity and comfort, adequate padding. As far as the black gloves, the dye is horrible. It turns your hands black after every use. I've washed them and spun them inside out about 6 times and the dye is still pouring out of them. I'd buy a pair of the natural color any day, but never the dyed gloves ever again. Dye is difficult to scrub off your hands. Have about 7 straight days of use and washing and it's completely irritating to deal with.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: I ended up getting XS! I'm an average sized male with average sized hands/feet(10 1/2 shoe), and I tried medium and small.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I got these for maximizing my strength training after my skin has decided to give out(Wear through). I'm an average sized male with average sized hands/feet(10 1/2 shoe), and I tried medium and small. Medium was FAR too loose. Small is more the looseness of driving gloves. I had to get the XS for tightness during climbing. Other than having to go down 2 sizes, the build quality is solid. I'll update if they start to break down. If you don't hear from me...they're still going strong! :D Disclaimer: I was not paid to write this review in any way, nor did I receive the product at a discount.
customer_reviews.author: B. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves! This is my 2nd set. My first set lasted me 8 years with hard use for a lot of that. I use these as work gloves. They have great dexterity and my hands stay cool. My 1st set failed where the collar is sewn to the leather. Started separating. I even left them outside for about two months by mistake and they still continued to preform well. I really hope this set service me as well. Get them!!
customer_reviews.author: Destinee P.

customer_reviews.title: Near Perfect- Rappel/Shoot/Belay
customer_reviews.text: I took these to a week long tactical rappel master class put on by Tactical Rappel Instruction (OnRappel.com) I have almost no previous rappelling experience. I did a TON of jumps and these gloves held up great. I really loved them. The only complaint is, I wish I would have gotten the Petzl ones with more leather on the back of the hand. On 1 jump my guide hand pinkie finger got very minor rope burn. That probably had more to do with my poor technique and not the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: JESSE

customer_reviews.title: Very nicely made gloves but they are not sized accurately
customer_reviews.text: Very nicely made gloves but they are not sized accurately. They stretch like nobody's business. I had to buy a smaller size and that has stretched as well. I read they used to be made better then they are now.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Friedman

customer_reviews.title: I never felt heat from friction and the stitching is amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a tactical training course I went through, they held up very well during the course. the few times I had a death grip on the rope they took the punishment well and hardly show signs of the torture I put them through. I never felt heat from friction and the stitching is amazing.
customer_reviews.author: KiEszentials_WorkinHome_Mama

customer_reviews.title: Every climber should have these.
customer_reviews.text: If you climb a lot, a pair of belay gloves is amazing. Keep your hands clean and increase safety by wearing them while belaying and rappelling. I always bring these with me on alpine rock climbs and wear them on the approaches so that I can protect my hands while moving through rough terrain and talus. Even at the local sport crag, these come with me every time.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves won't ever buy anything else.
customer_reviews.text: I had a pair of these previously that I misplaced so I snagged a new pair and could not be happier with them. I love these gloves they are great for climbing, caving, etc. and can really take some rope slide. I was doing a free belay and slipped and my hand took the slide of the rope for about 15ft without causing a burn and I was able to catch myself. Great Product- HIGHLY recommend.
customer_reviews.author: timewasted

customer_reviews.title: The dexterity is great with these gloves although if you're working with smaller ...
customer_reviews.text: The dexterity is great with these gloves although if you're working with smaller cordage its still hard to navigate knots (I bet even latex would have trouble). I took these gloves up half dome when the cables were "down" (no steps). This necessitated us holding on quite tight and they really shined when we descended because of the speed at which we went. No rope burns for me. I plan to take these on my next canyoneering experience. They tend to run large, I don't have particularly small hands but I fit a medium. I am 6 ft 220lbs.
customer_reviews.author: steven t ching

customer_reviews.title: The best gloves you can buy even if you don't climb mountains.
customer_reviews.text: I'm in a wheelchair and have been for 48 years. These are the best gloves I have found for wheeling my chair and saving my hands, The gloves don't twist when your holding your rims to break while going down a hill because the gloes are articulated. Their great.
customer_reviews.author: Louis Gratton

customer_reviews.title: After years of hard use these gloves still offer full ...
customer_reviews.text: After years of hard use these gloves still offer full protection with minimal wear. Im in the army and I've used these gloves for everything from mechanic work to weapons manipulation.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Chunky in all the right places.
customer_reviews.text: Have 3 pair. Best gloves you'll ever own. Super reinforcement around crucial areas. Buy everything Petzl. Awesome company, awesome products.
customer_reviews.author: Kouri

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a gift for my teenage son who wears them for skiing, biking and other outdoor activities. He wears them almost every day. These were a replacement for an identical pair purchased a couple years ago at REI... that were worn out. Excellent, fairly lightweight, flexible pair of gloves.
customer_reviews.author: C2CO

customer_reviews.title: Good gloves
customer_reviews.text: My last pair lasted a really long time That is why I bought them again. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love these!
customer_reviews.text: Love these! They're workhorses and they keep the dirt and water out! I'm always so annoyed with getting dirt under my nails and they're great for keeping it out. I also use them when mowing the yard and don't end up with blisters.
customer_reviews.author: jj

customer_reviews.title: Worked great.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for a 6 day technical rope rescue course. They worked wonderfully. I have smallish hands - medium fit great. The yellow color did slightly bleed onto my palms.
customer_reviews.author: D. Newton

customer_reviews.title: Great rappel and belay gloves
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are comfortable, easy to put on and take off, seem to hold up well and most importantly protect your hands while rappelling and belaying. They also have a convenient hole in the cuff that is perfect for clipping these gloves to your pack or harness. If you are in the market for rappelling gloves, you can't go wrong with these.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Parker

customer_reviews.title: I was nervous I wouldn’t have as good control with gloves on but that’s not the case
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous I wouldn’t have as good control with gloves on but that’s not the case. These protect my hands and I still have good rope feel
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Petzl K52LT Cordex Large Lightweight Glove
customer_reviews.text: As the name suggests they are a light weight glove. I like them for light rope work but if your looking for a helicopter rappel glove or one you will be rappelling for long distance where you need to break often I would look for a thicker glove. Its a fairly well made glove but the stitching could be better and the back vents keep your hands cool in warmer weather.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tree climbing gloves
customer_reviews.text: I am using this glove primarily for tree climbing. The leather seems like it will hold up to the climbing rope but time will tell. I purchased a size down for my purposes and could squeeze in. One thing I found to be negative, on discussion with other climbers as well, is the lack of friction on the palm. It is much harder to pull throw line or even climbing rope with the slick bare leather on these. This may get better over time.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Gorring

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These gloves are great, handle a lot of use and hold strong, another quality petzl product
customer_reviews.author: OutdoorsMan

customer_reviews.title: Fit great, comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Fit great, comfortable. I'm a female so I have smaller hands than males, but long fingers. I use these gloves for repelling and haven't had any issues or burnt through them.
customer_reviews.author: Kari Crump

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!
customer_reviews.text: Thanks very much for a pleasant transaction! Highly recommended!!! AAAAA++++++++
customer_reviews.author: Lor in PA

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality and comfort
customer_reviews.text: My favorite climbing gloves by far! As a tower technician it’s hard to find better product then those gloves, highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Alexandr Nagornov

customer_reviews.title: Great for rope rescue
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these gloves to use for rope rescue operations. Gloves are comfortable and allow good dexterity. Would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great for archaeology
customer_reviews.text: Used in a 6 week archaeology dig both while shoveling and screening. Other diggers had holes in their gloves after a few weeks but these were still going strong and I'll be taking them to the next dig
customer_reviews.author: Samantha M.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: I would recommend these there are high quality gloves I use them for climbing windmills and they work great
customer_reviews.author: Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Great work gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Work in the commercial refrigeration field and anything from brazing to taking hoses off liquid lines to fast roping material up and down. These last.
customer_reviews.author: Michael P

customer_reviews.title: Great for Paragliding
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves for paragliding. They provide good grip while holding the risers during inflation and grabbing the lines to pull the canopy down after landing. They are not too warm but do provide some protection during extended flights. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: matthias b jaffe

customer_reviews.title: Get these gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Love these glove. Great protection. Tears easily around the wrist. But I keep buying them because they protect hands well.
customer_reviews.author: Luck

customer_reviews.title: Great going down, okay going up, ride all day with them
customer_reviews.text: Work very well as Belay gloves. Tough to climb up the rope due to slickness in palm. Rock star quality. They second as bike riding gloves for me.
customer_reviews.author: Common  Joe

customer_reviews.title: and they're comfortable and rugged
customer_reviews.text: I use these specifically for rope work and climbing, and they're comfortable and rugged. Maybe a bit more expensive than other types of tactical gloves, but the palm material is thicker and works best for tree roping.
customer_reviews.author: Comanche6

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves for rappelling and canyoneering
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these gloves for use canyoneering in southern Utah and they could not be better. The gloves fit very well, can withstand submersion in water and anything else the canyons can throw at them. Rappelling was a dream, I could descend as fast as I wanted with no hand burning. Overall, great gloves, wish I had bought them for some of my earlier trips.
customer_reviews.author: Adam

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves
customer_reviews.text: Best gloves I’ve ever had. Lost them during an extended extrication and also ruined them with blood but absolutely recommend for anything fire service.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely love these gloves
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these gloves. Best pair of climbing gloves I've ever used in nearly 8 years in wind energy. The leather is thick, but flexible. The key areas of the glove are reinforced, and the velcro closure is sturdy. Definitely found my ideal climbing glove.
customer_reviews.author: Heath Spencer

customer_reviews.title: Good Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are very well constructed, and light enough to allow for working with tools without having to take the gloves off. They have excellent stitching and a good reinforced palm, but they are the lightweight. I do not recommend them for any fast rappels, as the palm will heat up quickly. For short recreational roping, or a combo with climbing I think they would be hard to beat. The cuff has a hole for biners, to allow for easy carry. They fit the hand great, and there is no excess material. A good buy at a fair price.
customer_reviews.author: GW

customer_reviews.title: supple leather that fit like a glove
customer_reviews.text: Soft, supple leather that fit like a glove. I have smallish hand and got the large...that was a perfect fit. These are exactly what you expect when ordering. High quality, should last for years.
customer_reviews.author: JimG

customer_reviews.title: Good Choice
customer_reviews.text: Great for rappelling, especially under high friction. Would be nice if it didn't retain water/sweat so easily.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: awesome equipment, i use it for my work at ...
customer_reviews.text: awesome equipment, i use it for my work at the rockwall. sometimes in hot weather you might get your hands a little bit dirty from the sweat and the material is made the gloves.
customer_reviews.author: pelaca069

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: These gloves fit as expected and are durable while keeping mobility.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Worth it.
customer_reviews.text: I am on my fourth or fifth pair. Needless to say I am a fan.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Very comfortable and durable, finger tips are designed to be able to pick up small objects I can easily pick up a quarter off the floor
customer_reviews.author: Dave

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this product
customer_reviews.text: I am in the US Army. I use these gloves for rescue rappelling and they’re fantastic, comfortable, and strong. They do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: these gloves are great for not just climbing but also as a good ...
customer_reviews.text: As all the rest of Petzl products, these gloves are great for not just climbing but also as a good pair of work gloves. I have a pair for climbing/moutaineering and another that I use for when I'm working with horses or general work around the stables.
customer_reviews.author: raul Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: these were great for an epic rappelling adventure i had at 7 teacups in california.
customer_reviews.author: aaron schwartz

customer_reviews.title: Great glove! I wear a medium and sometimes a ...
customer_reviews.text: Great glove! I wear a medium and sometimes a small in almost every glove possible, but this time, I had to order an extra small. So, I think it runs big. Otherwise, this glove is great. From junior carpenter to major league door kicker...it's a good glove.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Griffin

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves I work at as a zip line this ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves I work at as a zip line this and they do there job great with plenty of dexterity
customer_reviews.author: Austin Whisler

customer_reviews.title: I know these are climbing gloves but they have so ...
customer_reviews.text: I know these are climbing gloves but they have so many more uses. I own a cattle ranch and these are the only gloves I work in.
customer_reviews.author: RD

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great belay gloves. Well made and of good quality material. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Sam S.

customer_reviews.title: Nice gloves
customer_reviews.text: Used these gloves for repelling and belaying rope. Palms hold up well and are comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Brown

customer_reviews.title: Over priced.
customer_reviews.text: I read a lot of very favourable reviews about these gloves and I have some other petzl products that I really like, so I bought these. They are good gloves, but they are a little on the thin side and the leather is a bit slick, I would like something a bit grippier. If they were cheaper, ( a lot cheaper), I would have rated them higher, but they are way overpriced in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Brake

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Really terrific gloves; I use them for mountaineering and they cut wind well while still providing good dexterity.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kaschel

customer_reviews.title: Nice lightweight glove that offers ventilation
customer_reviews.text: Got these for the wife. Chose them over the Metolius (though I use those). Nice to have some ventilation available on the backs.
customer_reviews.author: J. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Great comfortable gloves. Lightweight and breathable. Use them for work everyday and love them.
customer_reviews.author: Dillon H.

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves!
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable gloves I've ever worn! Quality made, and worth every penny! The glove doesn't impede finger dexterity, there great!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas R

customer_reviews.title: Super nice gloves excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: Super nice gloves excellent performance , flexible finger and palm area is thick and strong. backhand area is mesh, cooling.
customer_reviews.author: ronald chu ming zu

customer_reviews.title: Great service
customer_reviews.text: The service was great and fast. I have a very happy child. The service was impressive. Thanks for the service
customer_reviews.author: Dude

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fit and function
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves because the mesh back allows air circulation and a great fit, and they are tough enough to withstand the punishment I put them through. I use them to stack wood, and all other outdoor activities in down east Maine.
customer_reviews.author: gottask8

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I rappel a few times a month. These gloves had held up in all weather.
customer_reviews.author: eric madsen

customer_reviews.title: Borrowed from friend, had to get my own!
customer_reviews.text: Love this glove. Borrowed a friends pair and they were so great I had to get my own. However I don't do much rope work, having these around for the times I do will be very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Ernie M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Awesome gloves! Hold realy well, and allow good feeling of the rope.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Comfortable Gloves
customer_reviews.text: These are the most comfortable climbing gloves I have had and they didn't require a break-in period, they were comfortable and great fitting from the start!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I bought these gloves as a replacement for the identical model. The 1st pair lasted 2.5 years of belaying. While durable, they are still very touch friendly and allow to tie in / off as well as other tasks without having to take them off.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Really nice glove but cant fit me well
customer_reviews.text: Really nice glove but cant fit me well. I have M size. But it still little bit big for me. I thing i need S size. I use it for abseil work.
customer_reviews.author: aizat

customer_reviews.title: Great Gloves for Rappelling
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for a climb up Grand Teton. The fit was excellent and are well made. I like the hole for hanging them off a carabiner when not needed. They held up very well on the climb and I expect they'll last a long time based on their performance on this trip. Great product!
customer_reviews.author: Steve F

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I love these gloves and have now bought 3 pairs
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: good fitting and great for canyoneering ... holds up to wet canyons too
customer_reviews.author: Cammy M.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves, but when gloves are wet leaves stained hands black.
customer_reviews.author: DIEGO CASALLAS

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for rappelling, belaying
customer_reviews.text: I use these gloves all of the time for rappelling and belaying, and absolutely love them. Super comfortable, bombproof, and great dexterity. Even in Texas, my hands don't get TOO sweaty after wearing them for a while. Can't imagine how they could be any better :)
customer_reviews.author: Dane Powell

customer_reviews.title: Awesome gloves!
customer_reviews.text: I have been on the hunt for some serious climbing gloves. I literally climb with the gloves on at the gym. They have held up very nicely. I would highly recommend these to anyone who wants quality "climbing" gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Kami

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: had to return due to sizing issue- then they didn't have a size smaller to replace....
customer_reviews.author: Myriah

customer_reviews.title: Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my husband who dose tree take downs and trimmings ever pair of gloves he has ever had get holes in them with in a week or two but these are going strong going on 3 months now even with daily ware. He would highly recommend them if you need a nice tough glove.
customer_reviews.author: Jocelyn

customer_reviews.title: My husband loves them
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these as a Xmas gift for my husband and he wears them as work gloves. Loves the ability to move and feel even with a glove on.
customer_reviews.author: Pen Name

customer_reviews.title: never touched water and by September the stitching had collapsed rendering this expensive Chinese knock-off useless.
customer_reviews.text: I bought these in July, never touched water and by September the stitching had collapsed rendering this expensive Chinese knock-off useless.
customer_reviews.author: jimmiJames

customer_reviews.title: Great gloves, but big for women
customer_reviews.text: These are awesome gloves, but I ordered x-small and they are still too big on me. I don't think my hands are particularly tiny or anything - it is too bad that they don't make gloves that fit women with women-sized hands!
customer_reviews.author: Kim

customer_reviews.title: They're gloves.
customer_reviews.text: Well, they have room for my palm and five digits...so that's good. Haven't put them to much use yet, but they seem pretty durable.
customer_reviews.author: Allan J

customer_reviews.title: Tough Gloves
customer_reviews.text: Great gloves. Fits true to size, the velcro wrists are a little long and stiff to add wrist support and keep debris from entering the glove. Which doesn't work well with a watch. FOr that hand I roll the cuff forward and attach it making it a shorter glove. Works well. Gloves dry relatively fast and allow hands to breath in warm and cool temps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Petzl - CORDEX, Lightweight Gloves for Climbers
product_meta.description: These lightweight belay/rappel gloves combine the durability of a work glove with the precise fit and dexterity of a thinner glove. Double-layered leather protects the palm and other high-wear areas. The back is made of abrasion resistant, breathable stretch nylon, ensuring comfort and fit. The low profile neoprene cuff with Velcro closure features a reinforced carabiner hole for attaching the gloves to your harness.
feature_bullets: THE RIGHT FIT: The CORDEX's ergonomic cut offers a high level of dexterity without being too tight, letting you belay and rappel without restriction.
HIGH-QUALITY: These leather gloves provide the perfect balance between durability and flexibility.
PROTECTS HANDS: The double layer of leather protects high-wear areas like the palm and between the thumb and index finger.
BREATHABLE: The abrasion-resistant stretch nylon on the back of the hand keeps the gloves snug and your hands cool.
ALWAYS ON HAND: The CORDEX's cuff features a built-in carabiner hole so you can attach your gloves to your harness.
